data.title: Where is my phone?
data.content:
I'm only posting here because I have no idea what I'm supposed to do next.

Early in October, I discovered my battery was swelling to the point where the case was starting to crack. So, naturally, I got in touch with support. They told me my phone was out of warranty, so I would have to send it in for repair/replacement without first receiving a replacement phone. It would take about five to ten business days.

I had to think about this, because this is my only phone. As in, I have no landline, and a phone is kind of a necessity for modern life. But I figured I could go a week or two without a phone. Better than having it explode or leak in my pocket at some point, right?

It arrived, according to Fed Ex, at the Google facility on October 5th. And then I waited.

And waited. 

And waited some more.

I heard not a word about my phone after I sent it in. No acknowledgement, no message of progress, no estimation of time, so I contacted Google via chat on the 19th. I talked to a very helpful person who looked into it for me and even went to a higher tier to find out what happened to my phone.

As it turns out, there are inventory problems, but no one contacted me to tell me so. The woman in the chat told me she'd see what she could do and promise to keep me updated. And she has.

About every 12 to 24 hours, I get a message that they are looking into my problem and will update me when any progress has been made. It's been almost two weeks of this.

I still don't have a phone. I don't know when I'm going to get my phone back. The person I chatted with, though helpful, is not high enough of a tier to expedite things.

So I'm sending it out here in the hope that someone in the Google hierarchy will notice this and maybe see what the deal is. Seriously, if I'd known I'd not have a phone for a month or more, I would have just chanced it exploding on me and tried to save for a new phone (not a Pixel, since it's so much trouble to get it repaired/replaced even when the problem isn't my fault).

TL;DR: Could someone at Google tell me details on where my phone is or an estimate on how much longer it will be or something? Anything? I realize coronavirus has made things a little weird, to say the least, but I really, really need my phone back.

data.title: Are all Pixel 2 XLs defective?
data.content:
This has been a horrible experience. 

Firstly I bought a completely new Pixel 2 XL. 

Little did I know, Google has been selling defective products through retailers and I am now only able to obtain a Refurbished replacement. If I wanted a refurbished product, I could have bought one for hundreds of dollars cheaper than what I initially bought.

I did as requested, sent my originally completely defective phone. And received a replacement. I immediately noticed that your promise of it being completely inspected and passing Quality tests was not upheld. 

I contacted Google again. Requesting they replace the replacement phone. As It has failed Quality inspection and was sent to me regardless. 

Again you requested that I send you my phone first. Meaning I had to use my old phone which barely works. Jeopardizing my job as I need my phone for work. 

So I complied and sent you the second defective phone. Days later I received a third phone. 

Yet again, the phone did not pass Quality inspection and was sent to me. 

I've had enough.

data.title: Why does my pixel 3a's clock freezes for a second or two each time I check the time?
data.content:
There's something annoying happening with my pixel 3a's clock when the power button is clicked after some time of the screen being black - the clock will show the time that's been the last time the phone got locked, and then after a second or two it will skip to the actual time. 

Let's say I've locked my phone at 3:05. Some time later, I click the power button to see what time it is. For a second or two, it will show 3:05 before it refreshes to show the actual time. Not cool.

This has been happening ever since it got updated to android 11. I was thinking this was a weird little bug, but now I'm thinking -  maybe it's a feature? And it's very annoying!
Is it really a feature? Is it a bug? How can it be fixed? I do not want to get confused every time I check the time!

data.title: Google Camera app on Pixel 3 crashing since July 4
data.content:
As of July 4 on my Pixel 3 my camera app crashes every time I attempt to open it. Also, as with many other comments I've seen online, my flashlight app is greyed out and cannot be turned on. Clearly the two are tied together.

Of note, I am able to open Snapchat and use my selfie cam within the app. When in Snapchat there is no longer an option to switch to the back facing camera. 

I have tried clearing the data and the cache for the Google Camera app, uninstalling and reinstalling the Google Camera app, removing all permissions from third party apps to the camera, restarting my device multiple times, restarting my device in safe mode, clearing the data and cache of my Google Photo app, and I installed the July 5 software update as of just this morning, all with no resolution.

I contacted Google's support via message option and was told that the only option left is a factory restart (which of course is only part of the trouble shooting options and as with any issue with a phone I've ever had will very likely do nothing to help, but I'm not able to try this this morning as I am not in a position to back anything up so I did not do so as of yet) and that since I'm out of warranty I am unable to send my phone in even if the factory restart does not resolve the issue. 

I informed them I've sent status updates multiple times since this started and inquired as to whether this is a known issue being addressed. Of course I was told it is not and that there is no work being done on what is clearly a software issue. I was told that they would pass on my issue and that "there are many user reported issues coming through that need to be addressed" but that they would pass this on at my request. 

I mentioned the fact that there was quite a bit of reporting done on the Pixel 2 camera issues and that if I have this issue then clearly others do as well and this has been reported to them, but as always they are going to play ignorant.

Once again Google is not owning up to software issues and is shoving them under the rug.

To add insult to injury the person "helping" me thanked me for my understanding, as if I had any choice in the matter.

Thank you, Google, for charging exorbitant prices for flagship phones that you do not support.

data.title: Pixel 3XL Constant Factory Reset Corrupt
data.content:
I get the message "Can't load Android system. Your data may be corrupt. If you continue to get this message, you may need to perform a factory data reset and erase all user data stored on this device", with 2 options:
1.    Try Again
2.    Factory data reset.
This has happen to me twice in the last couple of months. Not sure if the first time was shortly after an update or not, but my phone updated a couple of days ago and had been running okay. Both times it has happen in the middle of the night. The first time I just happen to wake up and noticed it was dead and stayed up to reset everything. This morning I woke up way late due to my phone has always been my alarm clock for over 10 years now, only to find it did it again and had to do a factory reset. Had to wait 7-10 minutes to go through the initial setup to even text my boss letting him know that I'm going to be late. Very frustrating and now I'm not sure if I can trust it anymore. I've used Google products for a long time, but lately I'm just not sure of the reliability of the products now. I have constant problems with my Chromecast Ultra too. Now I'll lose about an hour of my time installing apps, setting them up, reconnecting to Bluetooth devices (listening to actual radio on my way in to work was frustrating :-P), setting up additional email clients, and etc... Not to mention losing all downloaded data that hadn't been backup yet.

data.title: Battery drained in minutes. Not Charging.
data.content:
I had experienced a weird behavior with my Pixel2 phone. When am using the Pixel2 phone, within 2-5 minutes, the battery started draining from 20% to 0% instantly. To my surprise, I could see the drainage very fast within minutes. 
I tried to charge, ofcourse with original charger, but the device is not charging. 
As mentioned in these forums, I tried to charge the device for an hour and pressed Power button & volume down button to restart. But it didn't switched On at all.

I had charged for 4 hours and tried the above approach. It vibrated once and the red light was constant. It blinked for 3 times and it was constant most of the times. After 4 hours of charging, I don't see the red light at all. 

Later I tried to change the charger to see if the issue is with charger and charged for 5 hours. The issue is still the same.

One thing happened good to me is that the device is still under warranty, bought in Dec-2017 and Google gave 2 years of Warranty. When discussed with tech support, they raised a pick up request, and it's 3 days there is no update on the device. The device is still with courier and is in transit. Hoping the best that Google would repair or replace the device so that I can continue to use the device for some more month.

Last time it happened the same with Nexus, Pixel devices that the MotherBoard crashed on the next day of the warranty expiration., and I ended up spending thousands of rupees for Motherboard replacement. 
Wish Google would help me in this aspect and not let me to spend thousands again and again.

data.title: The "USB Not Recognized" error of Death
data.content:
Okay, I have scoured the forums (fora?) so I'm not just posting here without due diligence. Until a few months ago I was able to connect to my Windows system via USB, transfer files, everything was peachy. Then somehow I started getting the "USB Device Not Recognized" error. Tried every one of my six systems, tried different USB-A to USB-c (2.0 and 3.0) cables, tried different ports, updated my Pixel OS, am in Developer Mode, deleted Storage and Media caches and data - nothing changes.
I've tried to download the latest Pixel 2 drivers but everything is Zipped and when I unZip the packet there's no executable or seemingly anything I can use to point the :Unknown USB Device" in Device Manager to an updated driver.
Anyone have any new ideas?
Thanks for looking and any advice you might have.
Tom

data.title: Why has a OS or phone app now rendered my entire phone useless when calling people?
data.content:
Since the March2020 OS update and recent phone app update whenever I make a call - which includes answering a call, or clicking on a contact's number to call - as soon as I hit the answer button or the contact's number the screen goes black and the entire phone is useless.  Fingerprint doesn't wake it.  Power button does nothing.  Tapping the screen doesn't wake the phone either.  I can't end a call, I can't access the keyboard to entire in numbers for call centre menus, I can't swap to speaker, I can't put a call on hold, I can't mute, I can't even turn the volume up or down.

I haven't even put the phone to my ear to set off the proximity sensor so its not that.  I have no case or screen protector and my phone is always clean.  The phone sits face-up on my desk and when I answer it, BLACK. the only time it doesn't do it is when I have the stock pixel headset that comes with the phone plugged in.  When I answer or make a call with a bluetooth speaker or in car, or other type of headset it's the exact same issue.  Only the stock pixel headset will stop the screen from going black.

I have factory reset the phone, I have reinstalled the latest OS, I have ensured everything is update, I removed every non-stock app to see if it was a third party app playing havoc with the sensor.  None of that has fixed the issue.  Something is clearly wrong in the updates or the actual phone app itself.

data.title: Have a Pixel 1 bought new 9/18, now has the class action mic problem. Support won't help. Ideas?
data.content:
All steps taken to fix problem on my end (Complete wipe, software update, etc.) Originally contacted Google support 8ish weeks ago. Was told to take the phone to UBreakIFix for diagnosis and repairs. Was not expecting a lot of resistance given how widespread the issue was and the lawsuit that followed.

Spent several weeks going to multiple repair locations. Each told me the motherboard needed to fix the problem was no longer available, that Google destroyed the tooling needed to make more parts, and that repairs for all Pixel 1 and 2 devices were no longer available aside from screens. 

Spoke again to overseas-based support. Was then essentially told "Too bad, so sad, you're out of warranty." They of course are unaware of the manufacturing defect and class action. I bought the phone through an authorized reseller, and now have a bunch of money in a device that I can't use as a phone unless on Bluetooth or speaker. Assistant works about a third of the time. This is my 6th Nexus or Pixel device, and I pay for Google One storage for what that's worth. 

I basically got 15 months of use from this phone because of a defect I didn't cause. I don't care about settlement money, I just want the phone I bought to work. This is round 2 for me after my Nexus 5x developed the charging port issue and required replacement. Frustrated, any advice much appreciated...

data.title: Earbud middle button always triggers audio news now?
data.content:
I have a Google Pixel 3 and sometimes listen to news by saying "OK Google, tell me the latest news."  After I'm done with the news I usually just close the Google app (that was playing news), and continue to do other things while listening to ebooks in the @Voice Aloud Reader app. The earbuds' middle button can be used to pause and resume the ebook when I need to. Very convenient.

Recently I paired the phone with a new pair of Google 3 earbuds (my original pair was broken), and after the setup I found that the earbud buttons can be used to control Google Assistant. For example when new notifications come in, I can press the top button to listen to the notification, without taking the phone out of my pocket, which is very cool.

But then I bump into another problem: nowadays when I listen to ebooks in the @Voice Aloud Reader app, and press the middle button to pause the ebook, next time I press the middle button the ebook doesn't resume, instead the audio news starts playing. This often forces me to stop whatever I'm doing, take the phone out of the pocket, and manually close the Google app, to resume the ebook.

Is there an easy way to make the middle button only pause/resume the ebook in @Voice,  instead of always triggering the audio news? Or do I have to completely turn off the earbuds control with Google Assistant, to get back the convenience to pause/resume ebooks in @Voice with the middle button?
data.category: Google Assistant and Voice Actions, Google Pixel 3

data.title: The Pixel 3 tethering hotspot changes frequencies and bands fast, connected devices lose connection.
data.content:
I set up the wifi hotspot on the Pixel 3 to connect my laptop and other devices to the internet through my phone. I had a different Android before the Pixel 3 and did the same thing. When I sit on the train and move through areas with lots of other wifi networks/hotspots, which I will see, because the Pixel 3 will offer to connect to them, the Pixel 3 will change frequencies five six times a minute even between channels from the 5Ghz and 2.4Ghz band. 

My laptop will still show the connection, but the ping to the phone's IP (gateway) will fail. My other device behaves different. It will detect that the connection has failed and cease to show the wifi connected logo in the upper right corner, but none the less lose connection to the internet and have to be manually reconnected. 

This did not happen previously on the same train that I use to commute every day, when using my previous phone.

There might be other reasons for the loss of connection besides the Pixel quickly changing frequencies. This is only my suspicion, since the connection loss happens when I sit on the train and the train moves through the inner city. And because I see all the channel switches in my log files of my laptop.

I tried changing the preferred frequency. I usually have it set to 5 Ghz preferred, but the Pixel phone will most often still choose 2.4 Ghz. 

I also disabled bluetooth and wifi on the phone as well as the Google assisted location service (uses wifi) and wifi and bluetooth location search for apps. All of that does not help. 

I would love to force the Pixel to stop changing frequencies or manually set the frequency for the hotspot, but have not found a way to do that. Do you know how to enable that or do you have any other idea? My current workaround is to toggle flight mode on the laptop to reconnect about once a minute.

data.title: Pixel 3 wifi is super slow. iPad/laptop are fine. Wifi gets "fixed" when I turn it off and on again.

This happens when I'm 2 meters in front of the router with nothing blocking me and also happens when I'm in other rooms. My iPad and laptop don't have this problem. My roommate's Pixel 3 also has this bug.

One workaround we found was to toggle the wifi off and then on again. This seems to work most of the time. For example, when I open the YouTube home page everything will be black and loading. Then I toggle the wifi and almost instantly everything loads just fine. Same with Twitter. This works on my phone and my roommate's phone.

data.title: How to get "Pop" option back on photos my Pixel treats as portraits?
data.content:
It appears Photos tries to figure out whether the photo I'm editing is a portrait or not a portrait.

When a photo is a portrait, I get three options to play with when editing the photo in Photos: Light, Color, and Blur.
When a photo isn't a portrait, I get three options: Light, Color, and Pop.

Sometimes, however, I have a "portrait" photo that isn't really just a portrait. In these cases, Blur destroys anything in the photo that isn't a face, which is bad. And sometimes, Pop would be useful to have for these images (or any images, really).

How do I take a photo that has already been captured, and which Photos thinks is a portrait, and force Photos to let me edit with the Pop slider instead of the Blur slider?

data.title: 1st Gen Pixel Buds connect randomly, Now won't disconnect
data.content:
And the drama that is Pixel Buds continues. 

1. My Pixel Buds will randomly connect to my phone while still in the case (from another room!) without notice. I'll be in the middle of a call and all of a sudden, the audio is directed to the Pixel Buds.  The case never moves, it's not charging, just randomly makes the connection to the headphones...which are still stored in the case.  

2. On the flip side of this, now I can't get them to disconnect from my phone without turning off Bluetooth entirely. I want to listen to music via the speaker on the phone, but because they're connected to the Pixel Buds, it's sending audio there. I've made sure the headphones are seated properly in the case (the magnet clicks), I've cleaned the charging contacts on both the buds and the case, I even cleaned the entire buds to make sure there wasn't anything preventing them from making contact...and nothing. Eventually, not making the connection in the case is going to be an issue for charging as well. 

This is my second set of Pixel Buds (first one had wires protruding from the bend in the cable) and they've never worked quite right. Anyone have any tips on how to prevent random connections when most inconvenient and then to kill the connection when trying to return to audio via the device?

data.title: Pixel XL boot loop with locked boot-loader - how to save at least the data?
data.content:
Hi,

My wife's Pixel XL (gen 1) is stuck since one week in a boot loop that started suddenly when she was simply shopping online - on a trusted website. The bootloader was never unlocked and the phone never rooted, so this is stock kernel on stock HW. She was using the latest FW (QP1A.191005.007.A3) since some time without issue.
After the boot loop started, I tried to side load the official OTA image. The loading worked, but it didn't change anything to the boot loop. I did it a second time, no change. I then factory reset the phone through recovery mode, no change. Side loaded OTA again, no change.
I know the factory reset worked, since if I let the phone shut down long enough (or put it in the fridge), then it starts and attempts phone setup, but freezes while acquiring its IP address, and the boot loop soon restarts. I am thus unable to unlock the boot loader.
Since the boot loader was never unlocked (only USB debugging was activated),  it seems I have no way to flash the factory image or any recovery ROM that would allow me to backup the phone. Is there any way to get back the data that was on the internal storage? We don't care about app settings, but pictures and documents. adb backup doesn't seem to work in side loading mode, and adb wait-for-device never fires while booting, so no way to have a shell to manually backup.

Is there any hope? Either to get back the data, or to get a usable phone again.

I just hope this is not the same issue as https://support.google.com/pixelphone/thread/2235808
There are no official repair centers in Switzerland or around, so this is not an option.
I know that by factory resetting, the personal data was erased. But it is still mostly recoverable if able to dd the flash out of it.

Thanks in advance for your help!

data.title: Android 10 update on Pixel 2 XL breaks WiFi
data.content:
UPDATE 12/18/19:
Might have a workaround for us. Reset your network settings, reboot in safe mode (power off, power on, hold volume down button), open wifi and I attached to an older 2.4ghz only router. It still said "no internet" but I set the advanced settings MAC to my phone's MAC, and that didn't immediately work, but I then changed it to an "unmetered" network setting and boom....full network activity.  This has survived 2 reboots so far.

UPDATE 12/15/19:
Issue has returned after the "Phone" app was updated on 12/15/19.  No wifi's work...2.4ghz, 5ghz, nothing. And I'm actually connecting to a google fiber box. Reset network settings, reboot phone, reboot router....nothing. I need wifi to work or this fails to be a useful device in my life!
Google Engineering.....please fix this....quickly.



Android 10 update on Pixel 2 XL caused a WiFi issue where all wifi networks report "Connected, no internet access."

Tried to connect in Safe Mode to eliminate apps and antivirus (NOD32 ESET) from being a culprit...no change. I'm on Google Fiber with a google fiber router and I wondered if that had something to do with it. Reset router twice. Rebooted phone multiple times. Wiped network settings and restarted.  Tried an alternate router (but same WAN). Set MAC to fixed device mode. Toggled airplane mode on and off. Flushed DNS.

Resolution:  Factory Reset  :(

Further discussion: I am wondering if ESET had something to do with it as it had no permissions for device location and was flagging all my home networks as an "open" or "public" wifi hotspot. This error occurred immediately after update to Android 10, and after factory wipe. Changing location permission to allow fixed it. Consider uninstalling it BEFORE updating the OS....

data.title: Battery estimates wildly optimistic (until dead)
data.content:
This issue has been ongoing for roughly the last month. I suspect it began with an OS update but am not completely sure, as I couldn't be sure of the issue until about a week after it started.

The phone will start off the day at 100%, and gradually go down to about 93% over the course of the day. The problem is that the phone is not actually at 93% but at 0% at that point, at which it realizes "uh-oh, my battery is empty" and promptly shuts down.

This is particularly frustrating because it usually would not be difficult to plug it in or turn on battery saver, but I am not notified of the impending doom, eventually causing significant interruption.

Thanks in advance!

Any suggestions?

Thanks for your help
Janis

data.title: Pixel 4 XL Screen Pinning not possible anymore
data.content:

data.title: I am not receiving Google Verification message after enabling chat features - Google Messages
data.content:
First, a little background.  My carrier is Verizon Wireless and this is my first Pixel device.  I recently swapped to a different smartphone using the SIM out of my Pixel 2.  Prior to swapping devices, I had no issues with my Pixel 2, especially using chat features (RCS) in Google Messages.  
     At first I was not receiving SMS messages on this other phone.  I reached out to Verizon and they informed I would need to enable CDMA Less feature on my line/phone number.  Once this feature was enabled, I was then able to receive SMS.  However, was never able to use enhanced chat features through Google Messages.  So, I used the Verizon Messages app instead.
    This "other" phone was not a Pixel and I soon decided to switch back to my Pixel 2 after a few weeks.  Verizon recommended that I replace the old SIM with a brand new, mainly due to the CDMA Less feature that was previously added.  So, I picked up a brand new SIM at Verizon.
    Almost immediately I learned that the Chat features were not working properly on my Pixel 2.  It was stuck on "Verifying Phone Number" - "Setting Up".  Before you point me to the other forums, I tried all the troubleshooting steps mentioned there.  I cleared cache, storage in Carrier Services and Google Messages as well.   None of these steps resolved the issue.
    I spent hours in chat with both Google and Verizon.  Verizon explains that the CDMA Less feature is no longer tied to my line and the phone has been provisioned properly and everything looks good on their end, and refers me to Google.  Also, of course, they tell me my Pixel 2 is not on the supported list for RCS.  My wife has a Pixel 2 (same Verizon account) and chat features (RCS) work flawlessly on her device as well. 
    Google support advised me to leave feedback through the app and through the system settings feedback as well.  They also recommended that I contact the carrier.
    Well, I did determine what I believe is the issue.  I am not receiving the Google Verification message upon enabling the Chat Features in Google Messages.  Just not sure how to resolve. I swapped SIM cards with another device on my Verizon account, this is a Samsung J3.  Incidentally, chat features work flawlessly on this device as well.   I powered both devices off, and put the SIM from the Samsung Phone in my Pixel 2.  Of course, this configured my Pixel with the other phone number of the Samsung.  I enabled the chat features in Google Messages and the phone immediately received the Google Verification message and chat features began working.

Advice?  Ideas?

data.content:

I have a formerly Google Fi phone number that I used internationally this last summer that is now my family Google Voice number after cancelling the Fi subscription stateside and I have my original Google Voice number that is tied to my work account. Any ideas or suggestions?

data.title: "Save to device" for backed up video is not working - Pixel 2 XL
data.content:
It started acting weird this week...

Then, later I attempted to "Save to device" for those pics & videos individually (I wish Google Photos improve the method to RESTORE backed up photos & videos in BULK - without creating an album...), I got restored the pics, but for the videos, I couldn't download with "Save to device"... All the results were "Download Unsuccessful". 
So, I researched and tried a few different methods:
- Created an album with all 4 videos (from 11s to 2m43s) then download from within the album → FAILED 
- Get the link of the album (Select Share to create the link), copy&paste on Chrome browser on my cell (I only have a cell with me), select "Download All" →FAILED 
- Tried to Share videos individually to my Google Drive → FAILED 
- From My Google Drive, I tried to Upload → "Preparing 1 files for upload" appears and keeps going & going and NOTHING happens... (FAILED)
- From the above album opened in Chrome browser, open the video, then download individually → Worked only for 11s (shorest) & 2m43s (longest) videos, but the other 2 videos have been failing every time... 😫

I haved exhausted all the possible methods... and I still have 2 more videos I need to download... 😓

Whenever I power up my device I get this message "The bootloader is unlocked and software integrity cannot be guaranteed. Any data stored on the device may be made available to attackers. Do not store any sensitive data on the device. Visit this link on another device: g.co/ABH"

I read another forum post and it was recommended to "flash a factory image on the phone" using the steps found here https://developers.google.com/android/images . However I just got confused when looking through the steps. Like right off the bat it says it's easier and safer to "sideload the full OTA image", so I followed that link and one of the first steps says "Don't forget to either add adb to your PATH environment variable or change into the directory containing the executable." Suffice to say I have no idea what that means.  So is it really recommended to do this (what are some of the possible repercussions I don't?) and if so is there a video or some other guide anyone knows of that I can follow?

data.title: How to recover data if unable to connect phone to computer or see them in the phone? Memory issue
data.content:
Dear Google (or any kind fellow human-being),
I had some issues with the built-in photo app (the pinwheel logo), namely it kept crashing while browsing photos. Therefore I tried to reinstall it through the play store. Then something super weird happened: all my photos and data seemed to have gone. They are still on my phone, somewhere, but my (Google?) applications can't detect them, so all the photos I've taken (camera as screenshots) just don't show up, I can't play music in the stock music player, nor take any new screenshots/photos.

When I try to take a photo (with the stock camera app) or screenshot (by holding the power and volume key) it just says the memory is full, but it's clearly lying, since I can go in through the file browser and see there's space left. Also, all my personal ring tones, sounds, etc, have been replaced by some super weird stock ones (I presume; maybe even hard-coded midi files, by the sound of it...). The weird thing is that all other apps seem to work normally and I can, for example, take and receive photos with other apps.

Since all the data is clearly all there, I wanted to connect to retrieve it, but I can't do that either. I went to the store to get professional help, but they said they couldn't connect to the device, although their computer did sense "something" was connected, but they didn't want to install new drivers and instead directed me to you.

So here I am: can you please help me connect my phone to a computer and then fix the problem with my stock apps? I was told by the store where I bought the phone it has been reported to happen because all the Google apps are connected with one another.

I really to get help with this asap, because it's really embarrassing. I'm a staunch supporter of Google over for example Huawei, because I trust Google more, so I really hope someone can help me with this.

Thank you very much in advance!


Best regards,
Fredrik

data.title: Replacement device never reached to me
data.content: I had a charging issue with my Pixel 3 device, the C type charging port was no more working.  After using my phone with a wireless charger for a while I decided to send the phone back to google to get the replacement device.  I was living in Germany but bought the device from US, so I sent the phone back to US with a friend. Finally, the device was sent to Google back and the problems started. They first sent the refurbished device to the address that I provided. after 3 days of shipment period Fedex somehow did not deliver the phone and just returned it back to google without any notice. Then I asked them to send it again and the same happened. After this last delivery issue, they started to not send the device to me. A month has passed and no actions from google about the refurbished device. Each time it took a week to try to deliver the device and it gets returned to the warehouse once again. The only thing that they can say is to be sorry about the situation that I am faced. I already bought a new device after not having my phone delivered for a month. This is the worst experience that I have ever had with a phone and with customer service. They did not come up with any solution so I can get my device back. I decided to not even get back the device. I would prefer it to be sent to anyone who needs a refurbished google phone. This experience already teaches me to never go with google products to not face with this customer service experience.

data.title: The "USB Not Recognized" error of Death
data.content:
Okay, I have scoured the forums (fora?) so I'm not just posting here without due diligence. Until a few months ago I was able to connect my Pixel 2 XL  to my Windows system via USB, transfer files, everything was peachy. Then somehow I started getting the "USB Device Not Recognized" error. Tried every one of my six systems, tried different USB-A to USB-c (2.0 and 3.0) cables, tried different ports, updated my Pixel OS, am in Developer Mode, deleted Storage and Media caches and data - nothing changes.
I've tried to download the latest Pixel 2 drivers but everything is Zipped and when I unZip the packet there's no executable or seemingly anything I can use to point the :Unknown USB Device" in Device Manager to an updated driver.
Anyone have any new ideas?
Thanks for looking and any advice you might have.
Tom

data.title: What's is the escalation after india-pixel-escalations@google.com ?
data.content:
Hi Team , 

My pixel 2 restarts whenever battery is low, I logged many ticks but due to below reasons they cancelled my tickets 

1 ) Pickup hour are 9 am to 1 pm.... usually people go to work between thses times. ..no option for pickup in evening ...and Sunday aswell.

2) Your loaner mobile(nexus) doesn't support my sim- Airtel H2 , I don't know why ??? Coz it's a normal sim.

3) Every time the schedule get cancelled and I need to book it again ...no option to reschedule it .

4 ) Everytime I call to support person he doesn't have slots which are suitable to me.

With almost 7-9 calls and 4-5 pickup request ...I just no where ...till now ...coz I need to book an other request ... 


Now they gave me below reply , no slots are available also no loaner mobile they have ...

On Thu, Sep 5, 2019, 4:18 PM <store-support@google.com> wrote:
 Hi Himanshu,
Thank you for contacting Google Support Team.
I understand that you want the device to be picked up on Saturday. 
I tried contacting you on your registered phone number but your number was busy. We checked our resources and found that we do not have a slot available for device pickup via Field Service Technician as of now, so we can only arrange for a pickup via the mail-in process. In mail-in, the device is picked up and delivered by our courier partners and no loaner device can be provided for the same. Also, the turn around time for the mail-in process is 15 business days. Please confirm, if you agree for the device pick up via mail-in process, so we can create a new service request.
Awaiting your response.
Thanks!
Tarun
The Google Support Team

data.title: Pixel 3a won't charge
data.content:
My Google Pixel 3a (that I bought less than a year ago from T Mobile) turned off on it's own last night. I plugged in the charger that came with the device and tried to turn it back on, but it wouldn't. I left it to charge overnight and tried to restart, it still wouldn't. All I see is the "low battery" symbol that flashes when I long press the power button. I've tried all of the below: 
Long press power button for 30s to hard restart
Long press power button + volume down button for 20s
Double checked that the charger works on a different device
Double checked that my wall port works with a different device (laptop) 
Removed my phone case and accessories and removed any visible dust/ particles around the charging port. 
To me, it looks like a charging issue with the battery because the phone was working fine until the moment it turned off on it's own.

When nexus released in Kor, device support TTA-VOLTE.

These 2 lines can trigger supporting TTA-VOLTE.

data.title: Phone sent in for repair being held at Edinburgh DHL depot with threat of device destruction
data.content:
I have sent my phone away and believe that another user has posted the same issue with their product. I sent my Pixel 3 XL away via the Google packing box and DHL label to be sent to Poland. I sent my product on 21st November 2020 and on 25th November 2020 have received the following text.

We have your DHL shipment (XXXXXXXXXX) on hold at our Edinburgh depot as it contains a damaged electronics which are prohibited on our network. This will need to be collected from our service centre DHL UNIT 2 CHARIOT DRIVE EH28 8PA **This will be held for 30days before its destroyed**

I have yet had success raising my case to the Google support team and was hoping to escalate my case through the community as well if this was possible.

This is just to keep on record that I have done the best to my abilities to contact Google about this issue and I will not be able to break the law and travel out into another area of the country with a different lockdown tier not to mention it is a >120 mile round trip for me.

Best wishes,
Eric

data.title: pixel 2 weak LTE signal
data.content:
Is anyone else experiencing decreased signal strength since March 1st update? My pixel 2, immediately after the update, started showing no connection. When this started, the display would show the LTE icon, full bars with an x underneath. After restarting the device it shows me on H+ or 3G connection. This is mostly happening at work, not sure if it happens at home as i switch to wifi as soon as I'm home. Before the update I had no network issues at work. Nothing has changed at work, in the same office. Signal strength is decent around town. 

I've been working with T-mobile for the past 2 weeks doing resets. T-mobile put in a ticket with their engineering team to check on issues in my area. I've replaced the SIM card. T-mo found no issues on their part and are still trying to work with me to find a resolution. 

I realize T-mo doesn't have the greatest signal inside buildings, but as I mentioned earlier i was having no issues until the latest update.

One weird thing that's happening, my phone will show LTE signal with full bars when i arrive to work but nothing loads, not even slowly. i have to restart my phone for it to switch to H+ or 3G. 

Has anyone else encountered this? Anyone have any ideas they could share?

Hello, I would like to preface this by saying that I love the Pixel 2 XL, but it has provided an endless stream of problems for me. It's important to note that I purchased it from Best Buy Canada, through a wholesale company, but from what I understand, the process for certifying the Pixel is done by Google.

The first phone I received had a defective charging port, and defective bottom speaker. I had it refunded. The second phone, the most recent one, simply stopped working after approximately 2 weeks. I was wondering if anything could be done (on the part of Google), to resolve this issue.

data.title: Brand new Pixel 5 freezing for 3 - 10 seconds at a time
data.content:
This Pixel 5 was purchased yesterday. During normal use, the phone will become completely or mostly unresponsive and freeze up for periods of 3 to 10 seconds at a time. This seems to be happening regardless of which or how many apps are active, how long the phone has been on, etc. Restarts do not fix the issue. This issue can occur after a fresh restart when no apps are open. It just occurred as I was trying to write this sentence. 

Any ideas to fix this are appreciated. I have seen others posting about seemingly identical issues but was not able to find any official response.

Let me know if I can provide further information.

data.title: Very specific sounds are not working on my Pixel XL since 15th December.
data.content:
As of 15th December I have almost no sound from my device. Below are the instances that I can/can't hear sound.

I CAN hear sound when:
 - I can hear my ringtone when someone calls me
 - I can hear someone when I switch to speakerphone (they can hear me through the mic both on speaker phone and normal earpiece mode)
 - I can listen to music via earphones plugged in using 3mm cable (though my inline buttons are not working - not sure if this is related)

I CAN'T hear any sound when:
- I answer the call and listen using the default speaker at my ear
- I play media via spotify, Instagram, YouTube etc

The weird thing is, in the sound settings which break the levels into media, call, ring and alarm volume, only the ring and alarm volumes make a noise when adjusting the sliders. The media and call volumes do not make any sound.

Also, if I try to set a new ringtone for my phone or alarm sound, I can hear the demo noises. However, if I try to set the ringtone for notifications I cannot hear any of the demos.

What is going on? Hopefully someone can shed some light on the matter and the sound may follow ;)

data.title: Pixel 2 phone shuts down suddenly when playing audio or vibrates on low battery levels
data.content: Got a Pixel2 since launch with it having Android 10 installed. Since the start of this year, I've been having issues that shut down my phone at around 25% battery or less whenever I play audio on my phone speakers/alarm sounds/or sometimes a vibrate from a incoming call. Whenever it shuts down, it does sort of a like a sudden screen blackout without warning, with a few horizontal white lines in the middle; then if its somewhat >10%, it just restarts, but otherwise will stay off. I've downloaded some apps to check battery life (Accubattery), and it seems to be at around \~65% battery lifespan (though I'm not sure if this is an accurate measurement). However, I'm now very aware of when my phone is at low percentages, and am curious to know what could be causing the audio in low percent shutdowns to occur. As for physical damage to the phone, since a year ago ,I've only had one major drop to the phone's bottom left, with it landing screen side down causing a minor crack, but all parts of the screen still touchable and usable. Not sure if this is a common occurrence among the first set of Pixel2 phones, or this is just unique to my case. I've tried battery saver and turning it on/off to no avail, and also did a full battery charge to full drain to no improvement on the audio shutdown problem. I don't want to do a factory reset yet, as i am not sure if that's the fix for the problem, and would only waste time setting up stuff again if that's nit the solution. I need some direction to look into what I can troubleshoot or if this is a hardware defect, if someone has come across this before. Any and all help on this with this would be appreciated. Thanks

data.title: Pixel 3a diverts to voicemail. Seems invisibly stuck on Do not Disturb.
data.content:
I would really appreciate some help:

am a foster carer and must not miss calls.
I have worked for a few weeks to sort this out.

I have changed SIM (on the old phone).  Google then kindly switched the phone.
Problem repeated itself.

Do not Disturb is not (officially) on.

I have tested the phone by phoning from a selection of other phones. None of the numbers are set to Divert to Voicemail. First call from each number goes to voicemail (If they leave message I get a notification). If they do not leave a message I have no idea they have called.

I have gone into phone app, clicked 3 dots, gone to calls and calling accounts and ensure "receiving incoming calls" is on.

I wonder if an error was backing up to the replacement phone  (thus potentially introducing the error back to this new/refurbished phone?).

I only have three Blocked numbers on the phone. none are the ones I was calling from (to test it).

My call forwarding options are showing as follows:
always forward: off
fwd to voicemail when.....busy, unanswered, unreachable. 

This morning I did a reset of network & app settings . There was no visible benefit to doing this. 

My wife uses the same network as me (albeit on an apple phoen0 and has no reception issues).

The original Pixel3a worked perfectly for about 9 months before suddenly "getting invisibly stuck on Do not Disturb"). This replacement only arrived a couple of days ago but has same problem. 

One suggestion I have read on another forum (another user had similar problem) is that maybe a third party app is causing the problem. But where would I start tracking this down?

My next action was going to be to launch in Safe mode to see if that allows phone to ring. (is this a logical test?)

Fantatstic phone until it stopped ringing!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! 

Thank you for reading this.

data.title: Pixel 2 XL Bluetooth Issues
data.content:
In the last week or so, my Pixel 2 XL started to have issues connecting to my OontZ Angle 3 portable blue tooth speaker. I would turn the speaker on and music would play for about 3 seconds before the music would stop. I tried to follow the exact instructions to reconnect the device to my phone, but still it would not work. I could only get it to work if I turned my phone off and on again.

After several days of doing this, I went to the Bluetooth Device Details for my speaker. I turned off Phone Calls and suddenly my speaker started playing music again. I didn't think anything of it again as the speaker was pretty cheap, so I figured there was some weird thing off in the speaker.

Turns out, I was wrong. For the first time in about a month I tried to listen to music using my Pixel Buds as well and the same thing was happening: music would play for a few seconds and then stop. I went in to the Device Details for the Buds and turned off Phone Calls and it started working again. However, doing this also made it so I can't control my music with gestures on the Buds.

I can understand issues with a cheap speaker, but for a pair of expensive ear buds that were designed specifically to work with the Pixel 2 is a bit much. Is there anyway to fix the Bluetooth settings on my phone so I can actually use the Buds for their intended use?

data.title: Pixel 3A has major charging problems after Android 11 update
data.content:
my pixel 3a was working flawlessly with a wide range of USB chargers under Android 10.  

I've had all sorts of problems since the Android 11 upgrade a few days ago.  

I get weird error notifications talking about incompatible analog devices, or it asks me if the USB device is allowed to control the phone, etc etc.    yet, sometimes it charges fine on the same charger.    My favorite USB C chargers are Anker PowerIQ 3, both wall plugs and 12V automobile adapters, these have always rapid charged every USB C device I own including the Pixel 3A, but I'm also having  issues with older USB "A" chargers that are rated at 2.1 A, these always worked with Android 10 but now are nearly as flakey as the C "PD" chargers.   I've used numerous USB A-C and C-C cables, no differences.    Once in awhile, the phone charges, more often with a slow USB A 2.1A charger, so with a lot of persistence, I've been able to keep it charged.

Sometimes when I plug it into one of the USB C PD chargers, the phone cycles charging (not charging) charging (not charging) every few seconds for a few minutes, then quits.   unplugging, and replugging the charger doesn't help.     rebooting the phone doesn't help.

data.title: Verizon Unlocked Google Pixel 4 won't read my GSM Sim card when connected to the Internet
data.content:
Hello,

I just bought my new Pixel 4 phone from eBay. It was written that the phone is unlocked. I used a forwarder and imported the phone to Georgia (the country). I have done so, many times without any problem and everything worked perfectly before.

Now, I am having the following problem - when I first insert my GSM sim card, it works fine, I can make phone calls, send/receive messages and etc. But, as soon as I connect to the Internet, the phone says that the Sim card isn't supported and asks me to contact Verizon.

The phone is definitely unlocked, because it reads my sim without the Internet. Furthermore, Verizon has a policy, when after 60 days, they automatically unlock phones and 60 days has already passed.

So, I am quite sure that it is a Google problem (when I received the device, it had Android 10, I updated it to Android 11 and I still have the same problem). After a factory reset, the phone again reads the sim and again does not recognize it after I turn on the Internet.

Can someone help'?

Just in case, here is the video demonstration of the problem - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tR6bVrYVXqk

data.title: Pixel 3 XL - How to stop apps closing while actively using them?
data.content:
My Pixel 3 XL recently started to close apps while in use, this has happened with multiple apps open during multitasking, as well as when just using a single app such as maps for driving on it's own on a freshly rebooted phone.

I've tried a fresh start on the device returning it to factory settings and then only installing a select few apps - it still randomly closes apps and specifically Google Maps when being used for voice based driving directions. This is a consistent problem using maps for directions but occurs across nearly any visually intensive app as well (everything from chrome to YouTube to Pokemon go will just close fully while in use)

On opening the app again, it will start fresh as if it was evicted from RAM. I'm at wits end, I know these phones have memory management issues but I wasn't aware or told the applications would close DURING active usage.

Edit: I should mention that the regular Google Pixel 3 XL Memory Management Errors do occur as well, background apps are unable to keep their active state (or in the case of a music based background usage such as play music or pocketcasts - it will close them as soon as you switch to a new activity no matter how many apps are "open" in the task list). This is NOT fixed by turning off or changing any adaptive battery settings, the issue is the same regardless of any settings in adaptive battery settings.

data.title: How to upgrade Android on new Pixel before copying everything from old Pixel?
data.content:
I received a replacement for my Pixel 3 and copied all settings / data from old Pixel 3 to the new one (using cable method) and followed all prompts and waited until the new phone set-up was complete.

Sadly though, some of the apps were missing on the new phone, some settings were wrong too and my wallpaper / display settings were incorrect (all set to defaults).

I then realised my old phone was on Android 11 and the new replacement I'd received was on Android 10.

So I upgraded new phone to Android 11, then did a Factory Reset,  then went through the entire set-up process again and this time all apps / settings and wallpaper were copied over fine.

It would be cool if the set-up process detected the Android mismatch and gave an option to upgrade Android on the new phone BEFORE set-up does its stuff...... but meanwhile, as a suggestion.....

Perhaps you could amend your help pages (e.g. https://support.google.com/android/answer/6193424 ) to.....

describe how to ensure new phone Android version is greater than or equal to Android version on old phone BEFORE starting set-up, then (if needed)
describe how to exit set-up and do Android upgrade beforehand

Might save some confusion and having to run set-up twice.

Cheers all

data.title: Inherent problems with Pixel 2: camera, phone crashing
data.content:
Numerous problems of similar nature, would appreciate if anyone has found solution to any, Google Email support has been of no help. 

1. Pixel 2 randomly switches off phone when:
        a)  you open any app that uses camera (including Google's camera app) 
        b) sometimes when a call is coming - and then it doesn't show that missed call
        c) even while it is charging!! And it shows the 0% discharged sign while it is charging and has a significant amount of battery left. 
        d) randomly at other times when using the phone, this is extremely annoying because the battery drains significantly when this happens (more on battery draining/battery life on number 4). This is also dangerous because if I'm travelling I need to have a reliable phone that won't randomly switch off while I'm trying to call or use the phone. In detail this happens even when on the home screen but also with apps namely like Ola. *disclaimer: not an ola app problem, since this happens with a lot of apps and even while an app isn't even being used.* 

2. Problems with Camera: 
         a) Camera randomly stops working, the video doesn't record - gaps in video, 
         b) photo disappears after being taken, 
         c) or the photo doesn't get taken, phone hangs on camera app and must be restarted. 
         d) Additionally, the time lapse feature randomly works and doesn't work: sometimes it is able to stay on for 30 minutes, but other times it switches off by itself after 10 seconds.                       Timelapse randomly automatically switches off. 

3. According to cnet (for lack of information regarding battery life given on google's official website), the battery life of the Pixel 2 is supposed to be 13 hours, however it is barely averaging 6-7 hours in a day, and that's with battery saver on. 

4. The phone has also randomly switched off and refused to turn on two times, wherein I had to force reset it by going to the BIOS screen; this happened completely randomly and has taken place twice already. 

5. When calling, or even if not, there are some weird sounds at a (high?) frequency that are emitted from the speakers, this isn't a huge problem but I don't understand why this is happening. 

6. While Pixel 2 is charging (using Google's original adaptor and usb a to c connector with usb a to c cable) the charging reduces!! If the battery is 11% before charging, after "charging" it becomes 10%; however when the same cable is plugged into a laptop, it charges albeit slowly - I'm guessing the connector shouldn't be used for charging?

data.title: Refurbished Pixel 3 not switching Google Wifi points smoothly
data.content:
Refurbished Pixel 3, running Android 11 beta 3.
Just got it about a week ago, not from Google.
Noticed that when I move from room to room, it switches from Google Wifi puck to Google Wifi puck, but not smoothly at all.  A lot of times it'll hold onto a signal from a puck far away as I walk across the house, then switch to LTE only, and then about 10 seconds later pick up the newer, closer Google Wifi puck.
This is my first Pixel 3 but we have other Pixels in the house (3a, 2, OG) and they all hold onto the Wifi smoothly from room to room across the house.

I already assigned a static IP.  Didn't seem to help.

I tried it in safe mode.  Also didn't seem to help.

I don't have any weird apps on it -- the exact same ones I had with my previous OG Pixel, which didn't do this.

My guess is that I have a wonky wifi unit (i.e., hardware problem).  In the grand scheme of things this is a minor annoyance and the world won't end.

And as the other phones don't do it and my Google Wifi setup hasn't changed in 2 years, I don't think it's the Wifi.  I "turned off and on again" all the google wifi pucks just in case it was acting funny after an update or something.  No difference.

Could this be a known 11 beta 3 bug?  (did it in 2.5 also).  I didn't really use this in Android 10 -- as soon as I got the phone I upgraded to 11 beta 2.5.

I don't want to factory reset the phone.  Not worth it.  Especially since I just got it (have had it for about 2-3 weeks) and the apps are exactly the same as on my OG pixel.

Any thoughts/ideas welcomed.  Not expected anyone to solve this.  Just wondering.

thanks.

data.title: What's going on with the multitouch? (Pixel 4a)
data.content:
Hi everyone!
I've bought a Pixel 4a that arrived on Tuesday, for my wife.
Since that, first thing we did was to set it up and download all the updates.
Yesterday I realized that typing w/o swype felt very buggy and, checking it further, THERE'S NO MULTITOUCH IN THE SCREEN.

I was about to factory reset the device and, for some reason, it began working again... After a while, it came back to not-normal.

After closing all the apps, a hard reset and factory reset, the problem persists as the phone won't recognize more than one touch simultaneously. I've also enabled the High sensitivity option in the Screen menu. We don't live in the States so returning the device is nearly impossible for us.
The device has the OMOTON screen protector but I'm 80% sure that this isn't the root cause.

Shall I remove the screen protector or wait for further software updates?
Any idea?

Thanks!!!

data.title: Pixel 4 XL not charging, only works/turns on when plugged in, and battery constantly stays at 58%
data.content:
About a week ago the phone turned off randomly and when powered back on it said it was at 50% despite turning off around 35%. Then it was fine for a while. Then when I restarted my phone to finish an update yesterday (April 16th), again displayed it at 50% despite me having just taken it off the charger at 100%. Now since last night my phone has been saying it has a 58% charge, not only that the thing lasts about 30 seconds after taking it off the charger. I can only use the phone while it's plugged in. I got the Google pixel 4 XL for Christmas just 4-5 months ago.

Today I tried factory resetting, deleting new/un-used apps, changing a few settings to help battery life. Nothing worked so far. Any tips?

EDIT: and on top of all that I've noticed my phone has been super choppy and slow when scrolling through messages, Snapchat, and other apps/pages where you can scroll up and down

data.title: Has google figured out the obvious issue they have with software clashes on pixel phones yet?
data.content:
Well here goes , long story cut short. Since the day i setup up my pixel 3a it has had soft and hardware issues.  Could be multiple issues but i have identified a few and realise a new one that is causing problems. Google play music since day one seems to notify me it trying to update.  I don't use it and have not for years. Had one song one it.  But seeing as they are phasing it out and starting YouTube music.  Why have they bothered to preinstalled it on my device. Issues got worse when i opted to enjoy a free 6 month trial with apple music offered by my network provider.  Honestly i don't think the apple music app does well on a pixel anyway. But it has affected hardware mainly volume of music and various other software issue. issues. But last night i decided to access Google dashboard to try and wipe permanently the play list it claim i have in play music account that are not.  It offered to transfer them to yt music so i though go for it.  What is did was transfer playlists i had set up in apple music. So clearly a clash between and Google play music and yt music app issues. And now all those playlist are on yt music . With the one song i had in Google account. But yt music app setting are now clashing in the triangle of google play music, apple music and yt music app.   I am finding the yt music web page has amazing play back volume through chrome of all browsers, but absolute shockingly low and the equaliser settings seem to be like a petulant toddler that change themselves or do not change at all in the app. This has had a profound affect on my device and has definitely caused it to  suffer before its time .  So how do i get them to accept this and get a replacement that has not suffered the strain due to Google not thinking this through.   40gb data plan a month and i ain't using more than 12% because i just have given up with my phone.     It really has not helped with all the ways Google back up you data in various ways as you can not getting it clear enough. Device personalisation services just another spanner in the works that pushes the issue even after factory reset.   Feel so let down as i have been an android user since htc first released smart phones . Now Google the creator of android have come so far and messed up spectacularly.  And honestly i really hope i am right about this because if not then not only have they left use with a worse os than year gone by but clearly are producing poor quality hardware.  I am one of thousands having similar issues. This is not a user issue, but a google problem 😥


P.s. they also have the nerve to call this a community but yet i can not comment on others questions that are having the similar issues. Why, because they do not want users communicating and figuring out between us that they are at fault.
data.category: Setting up and Personalizing your Device, Google Pixel 3a
